application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Identifying Media Bias in Online News

analytic.title: Identifying Media Bias in Online News

biblStruct.note: Identify trends in the selection and presentation of online news

div.p: • Events are clusters of news articles by event registry by time, location and key words CS 229: Machine Learning -Final Project
• Trained Multinomial Naïve Bayes (NB) and Multiclass SVM models to discriminate between 8 news sources based on article title tokens.
• Accuracy of classifiers validates keyword analysis.
• NB yields ) for every (word, news outlet) pair • Informally, model how indicative a token is of a given news outlet as:
Tokens that maximize the above value for selected news sources:

figure.figDesc: TIME, Los Angeles Times, Truthdig, DIE WELT, The Japan Times, San Francisco Gate, Ad Hoc News, The National, N24.de, Thomson Reuters Foundation, The Irish Times, www.greenpeace- magazin.de

treaty, solidifying, update, kill, vatican, agrees, relationship, troops
Keyword Analysis
To study event selection bias, we examined the news outlets by: • Frequency: Number of articles on each event • Binomial: Whether the source reported on each event • Normalized: Frequency norm2 normalized and centered about zero
Figure 1: Frequency [left], binomial [center] normalized [right] vectors of 600 events. PCA units omitted. Representing article frequency makes all local news sources outliers due to report propensity. Event binomials represent cherry picking. Events normalized show good spread.
KNN, Mixture of Gaussians, Hierarchal Clustering had similar results.
